newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuelan jail fire kills about 40.
newsitem.headline: Venezuelan jail fire kills about 40.

text.p: About 40 prisoners were burnt alive early on Tuesday when a fire apparently caused by prison guards broke out in a Venezuelan jail, officials and human rights activists said.
"The version that the prisoners are telling me is that about 40 were burnt to death," activist Olimpia Hung told reporters outside La Planta jail on the southwestern outskirts of Caracas.
Justice Minister Henrique Meier agreed the number of deaths could be as high as 40. Asked in a telephone interview if the death toll could be that high, he told Reuters: "Yes, it could be."
The fire started when National Guardsmen closed off a wing of the prison and threw in tear gas canisters, Meier said.
He said it was unclear why the guards had locked up the prisoners and an investigation would be launched into the cause of the fire.
